required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Dexmedetomidine on Activity in the Subthalamic Nucleus
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Dexmedetomidine on Neuronal Activity in the Subthalamic Nucleus During Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) Electrode Implantation Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to find out whether dexmedetomidine changes brain cell activity in the subthalamic nucleus (STN).

detailed_description.textblock: In order to find whether dexmedetomidine is optimal for sedation during Deep brain stimulation surgery, we will measure the electrical activity in the STN during Deep brain stimulation surgery, and measure how this activity is changed during administration of Dexmedetomidine. We hypothesize that dexmedetomidine does not change the firing rate and pattern in the STN.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Average Population Spiking Activity
primary_outcome.description: We calculated the root mean square (RMS) of the high frequency electrical activity. This is a common measure for the spiking rate of the population of neurons in the vicinity of the electrode tip. This Measure has been previously described as a useful measure to determine the target location during deep brain stimulation (DBS) procedures. We calculated the change in RMS inside the STN between baseline and peak sedation. For each subject we normalized the RMS to the RMS of the electrical activity outside the nucleus. This is done to eliminate the effects of noise and variability in electrode resistance. Thus, the normalized RMS is a pure number with no units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Average Firing Pattern in the STN
secondary_outcome.description: We've used total power in the Beta range (13-30Hz) to evaluate change in firing pattern and oscillation frequency.
The time it takes for the patient to become alert after drug administration is stopped.

secondary_outcome.measure: Portion of Participants With Timely Return of the Neuronal Activity to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The portion of patients in which neuronal activity returned to baseline within 30 after stopping sedation.

arm_group.description: The study is performed in patients undergoing DBS electrode implantation to their STN for the treatment of parkinson's disease. Microelectrode recording (MER) is performed as part of STN electrode implantation surgery, to increase the precision of the stimulating electrode placement. The study includes administration of dexmedetomidine while recording electrical activity at a single location to evaluate the effects of this drug on the MER.

intervention.description: Dexmedetomidine infusion will be started with a loading dose of 1 mcg/Kg over ten to 20 minutes followed by a maintenance infusion of 0.7 mcg/Kg/hr until stable sedation is achieved.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled to undergo bilateral STN electrode implantation surgery with Micro-electrode recording for the treatment of Parkinson's disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to dexmedetomidine
- Bradycardia: Sinus rhythm slower than 50 bpm
- Known or suspected obstructive sleep apnea
- Suspected difficult intubation
- Pregnancy
- Under 18 years of age or over 85 years of age
- Cognitive disability impairing understanding the experiment or signing the informed consent form

overall_official.affiliation: University of Wisconsin, Madison, Department of anesthesiology

facility.name: University of Wisconsin - Madison, School of Medicine and Public Health

group.title: Dexmedetomidine During MER
group.description: Administration of dexmedetomidine during the Microelectrode recording (MER) part of subthalamic nucleus (STN) electrode implantation surgery. Dexmedetomidine: Dexmedetomidine infusion will be started with a loading dose of 1 mcg/Kg over ten to 20 minutes followed by a maintenance infusion of 0.7 mcg/Kg/hr until stable sedation is achieved.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine During MER
group.description: Administration of dexmedetomidine during the Microelectrode recording part of STN electrode implantation surgery. Dexmedetomidine: Dexmedetomidine infusion will be started with a loading dose of 1 mcg/Kg over ten to 20 minutes followed by a maintenance infusion of 0.7 mcg/Kg/hr until stable sedation is achieved.

outcome.title: Change in Average Population Spiking Activity
outcome.description: We calculated the root mean square (RMS) of the high frequency electrical activity. This is a common measure for the spiking rate of the population of neurons in the vicinity of the electrode tip. This Measure has been previously described as a useful measure to determine the target location during deep brain stimulation (DBS) procedures. We calculated the change in RMS inside the STN between baseline and peak sedation. For each subject we normalized the RMS to the RMS of the electrical activity outside the nucleus. This is done to eliminate the effects of noise and variability in electrode resistance. Thus, the normalized RMS is a pure number with no units.
outcome.population: All participants had the normalized RMS of the electrical activity calculated during control period, and under maximal sedation, and the difference between the two was calculated and normalized.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine Modulation of MER
group.description: Change in RMS value between baseline (awake) and maximal sedation during dexmedetomidine administration.

measure.title: Change in Average Population Spiking Activity
measure.description: We calculated the root mean square (RMS) of the high frequency electrical activity. This is a common measure for the spiking rate of the population of neurons in the vicinity of the electrode tip. This Measure has been previously described as a useful measure to determine the target location during deep brain stimulation (DBS) procedures. We calculated the change in RMS inside the STN between baseline and peak sedation. For each subject we normalized the RMS to the RMS of the electrical activity outside the nucleus. This is done to eliminate the effects of noise and variability in electrode resistance. Thus, the normalized RMS is a pure number with no units.
measure.population: All participants had the normalized RMS of the electrical activity calculated during control period, and under maximal sedation, and the difference between the two was calculated and normalized.

outcome.title: Change in Average Firing Pattern in the STN
outcome.description: We've used total power in the Beta range (13-30Hz) to evaluate change in firing pattern and oscillation frequency.

Dexmedetomidine: Dexmedetomidine infusion will be started with a loading dose of 1 mcg/Kg over ten to 20 minutes followed by a maintenance infusion of 0.7 mcg/Kg/hr until stable sedation is achieved.

measure.title: Change in Average Firing Pattern in the STN
measure.description: We've used total power in the Beta range (13-30Hz) to evaluate change in firing pattern and oscillation frequency.

outcome.title: Time to Recovery
outcome.description: The time it takes for the patient to become alert after drug administration is stopped.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine During MER
group.description: Administration of dexmedetomidine during the Microelectrode recording (MER) part of subthalamic nucleus (STN) electrode implantation surgery.

measure.title: Time to Recovery
measure.description: The time it takes for the patient to become alert after drug administration is stopped.

outcome.title: Portion of Participants With Timely Return of the Neuronal Activity to Baseline
outcome.description: The portion of patients in which neuronal activity returned to baseline within 30 after stopping sedation.
outcome.population: All participants that received sedation. As the activity did not return to baseline within the allocated time for the study (30 minutes), we report the portion of patients in which the activity returned to baseline within this time.

group.title: Dexmedetomidine During MER
group.description: Administration of dexmedetomidine during the Microelectrode recording (MER) part of subthalamic nucleus (STN) electrode implantation surgery.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
